instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00163: What is 820-00163? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1398: What is A1398? A1398 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2015, Mid 2012, Early 2013, Late 2013, Mid 2014 with EMC 2909, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00138, 820-00163, 820-00426, 820-3332, 820-3662, 820-3787..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Infinite Chime Loop Blackscreen
threads.message:
Have an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> EMC 2910 Macbook pro , customer said he trying to flash clover on his device and accidentally installed in EFI folder. 

So i pulled SPI chip and cleared RegionME using these links:

[url]https://www.win-raid.com/t596f39-Intel-Management-Engine-Drivers-Firmware-amp-System-Tools.html[/url]

[url]https://www.win-raid.com/t1658f39-Guide-Clean-Dumped-Intel-Engine-CS-ME-CS-TXE-Regions-with-Data-Initialization.html[/url]

but no dice. 
Either I need a whole new .bin to work with or im missing something.

Does anyone here have any experience with this?

thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Infinite Chime Loop Blackscreen
threads.message:
Try new BIOS file, if you suspect BIOS issue.
ME region can help in this case I suppose.
Of course you will need clean ME, or keep ME region from backup, just for test.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Infinite Chime Loop Blackscreen
threads.message: Yeah that sounds like a good place to start. Ive already pulled original and cleared RegionME but still chime loops. So maybe just clearing someone elses BIOS.bin will do the trick. Ill try that and post results. Thanks for the reply

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Infinite Chime Loop Blackscreen
threads.message: yeah found a bin for same model/emc cleared RegionME, flashed it and problem fixed??

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Infinite Chime Loop Blackscreen
threads.message: I don't understand if you tried it, or just ask...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Infinite Chime Loop Blackscreen
threads.message: lol oops, i dont know why i added question marks to the end of that sentence...job is done thank you

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Infinite Chime Loop Blackscreen
threads.message:
Good to hear that.
Means the main BIOS zone has been f***d, not only ME region.
In fact, original ME region could still be good; just try it, if have time.
